main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified objects by observers at Holy Cross College in Worcester, Massachusetts on April 22, 1957
interesting points: The first sighting was of a single dust-red colored object, about the size of a half dollar held at arm's length, that traveled from north to south overhead in 7 seconds.
The second sighting was of 7 small, silver-colored objects in a straight line, observed for about 7 seconds.
The third sighting was of 2-3 darker objects in a 'V' formation that dropped in altitude over about 20 minutes.
The sightings occurred while the observers were looking for new comets.
The witnesses were observers at Holy Cross College in Worcester, Massachusetts.
result: The objects were concluded to be ballistic missiles or high-speed aircraft.
sighted object: 17-12 unidentified objects of varying colors, sizes, and formations
witnesses: Civilian observers at Holy Cross College
